Text: Unify Cc Bob Superty with a list of pipelines whom were late or had nomiation issues as a result of this mornings Unify problems

EOL Deal Ids In Path Manageryou might want to see this Forwarded by Edward TerryHOUECT on AM From Matt nronXgate on AM To Edward CT George F CT Patti CT Katherine L CT Robert CT Victor CT Beverly CT Donna CT Richard CT cc Chris nronXgate Brian nronXgate Bob M nron Bryce CT Subject EOL Deal Ids In Path Manager As youre aware were having to bridge Houston Street ids into Unify from Sitara We are being asked as a requirement to not display the EOL id on statements that are identified as Broker EOL trade deals originating from EOL We have two options to accomodate this requirement Option is to have the modify the bridge code to not bridge over the EOL deal id if the deal is a Broker EOL trade deal One of the drawbacks of this option is that you wont be able to referenence the EOL id on the Path Manager for these related deals All other deals will have the EOL deal id if applicable The EOL id would not show up on the statements because it wouldnt be populated Option is to modify several areas of code in the Settlements area which may be more time consuming The obvious code change would be in the statement generation area as well as other report type information Option allows you the greatest flexibility while Option may be quicker to implement Please pass this along to others in your group and get feedback Please share your thoughts Ive attached an email explaining the Broker EOL trades This is not to be confused with Broker deals done at a given point with not transportation These will continue to come across as youd normally expect Any questions please ask Thanks

Link to the HPL Scheduling Mailboxfollow the instructions below Why A suggestion was made by Carlos to centralize transport nominations we receive by email We now have an email account set up The group is to let our customers know this is where all nominations need to be sent This way if people are out or no longer with us someone will be able to receive the nomination change I have also created folders for each shipper As each nomination is addressed the file is to be moved to the folder for later reference If the file is still in the inbox it has not been addressed Any comments to this I would greatly appreaciate feedback Forwarded by Edward TerryHOUECT on PM From Enron Messaging Security ENRON AM To HPL Scheduling Team cc Subject Link to the HPL Scheduling Mailbox Doubleclick on the link and the mail box will be added to your Lotus Notes Workspace Each of you are editors of this mailbox The Internet address is Just in case the mailbox is located NAHOULNMAIEnron under the Mail folder The following have access Michael OlsenNAEnron Tom ActonCorpEnron Mary PoormanNAEnron Eddie JanzenNAEnron Edward TerryHOUECT Robert CottenHOUECT Aimee LannouHOUECT Jackie YoungHOUECT Carlos J RodriguezHOUECT Mark McCoyCorpEnron Sabrae ZajacHOUECT Thanks Sandy Rivas Enron Messaging Security

ENA Adjustment at NvillePer the memo ENAs storage account will be REDUCED by mmbtu Forwarded by Edward TerryHOUECT on AM Robert D Morgan AM To Harold CT cc Randall NRON Hugh NRON Robert CT Edward CT Anita K CT Subject ENA Adjustment at Nville The results of the February th PVT test conducted on Nville have been discussed with each of you over the last three months As we have discussedeffective Sep th Anita will make the adjustments to Enrons inventory and pad gas to reflect the February th results I talked with Gary Wilson and he confirmed that the revised values are correct Attached is a spreadsheet that contains the values The correction to the working gas includes TWO corrections The results of the February th test reduces the working gas by MMBTU In addition there is a reduction of MMBTU which is the difference between the SCADA values Best Available that Anita showed on the February th Storage Sheet and the official February th values that Gary Wilson received from MIPS To summarize Enrons pad gas will now be MMBTU instead of MMBTU Enrons working gas will be reduced by MMBTU Call me if there are any questions
